data.title: Teaching Machines
data.description: How can we teach a machine by example?

data.title: Learning From Machines
data.description: Can we use machines to discover new things about our world?

data.title: The Mystery of Generalisation
data.description: How is it possible for machines to succeed in tasks they have not previously seen?

data.title: Achilles' Spear
data.description: What sort of tasks can learning machines do well?

data.title: Mathematical Recall
data.description: How can we use mathematical constructs to store behavioural information, and recount these behaviours when the moment is right?

data.title: The Sobering History of Artificial Intelligence
data.description: Trace the development of machine learning techniques, from the whispers of artificial intelligence in anthropomorphic automata to contemporary massive algorithmic learners - some of the most sophisticated technology we have invented.

data.title: Is Machine Learning Science?
data.description: Explore where machine learning lifts away from the rigour of computer science.

data.title: Algorithmic Bias
data.description: Find out what it means for an algorithm to be 'unfair' at a moral and mathematical level, and discuss some techniques for improving algorithm fairness.
